utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Umm, how may I help you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So yeah I've been having for the last two days, uh, it just started randomly. I had to miss work, Just a headache started at the beginning and then I noticed the same day, so this was two days ago. A headache started and my body just started aching throughout the day and yesterday I just developed, I think it was a fever, I didn't really get a chance to check, like, but I was very chilly yesterday and now I have this cough as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so just to confirm, so the, the symptoms at first started with a headache and, and fatigue, and that started two days ago?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, like with fatigue, like also just the, my muscles were aching.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any particular muscles that were achy or is this more of a, uhm, general kind of whole body feeling?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just a general whole body feeling.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uh, and in terms of the headache, could you describe, uhm, could you describe the headache?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, it's just kind of like at the front like near my forehead, on, on kind of like both sides more. It just feels like, like pressure in there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had headaches like this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, not really.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, is the headache on one side or, or the other or on both sides?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think it's like both sides.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And is the headache like pulsating or is it more, continuous kind of constant pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think it's more continuous constant.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and have you had any sensitivity to light or sound that, that's made the headache a lot worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's, it's kind of just there, it's about the same as when it was when it started.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any nausea and vomiting associated with that, the headache or anything else?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And so, and then, last question for the headache piece. Does it feel like it was a like kind of sudden onset, worst headache of your life sensation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, it's still like, like I can still cope with it, like, if I wanted to I would have gone into work. But it was the muscle aches that really started bothering me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And so you had a cough as well, when did this start, and is it a dry or wet cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's a dry cough and it started yesterday, probably in the morning when I woke up.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and has the cough been getting any better or worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, since yesterday I would sayit's probably a bit worse now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and it's dry, but have you seen any blood that's come up?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, no blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have you had any shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any flu like symptoms or infectious symptoms like a red eyes, runny eyes, runny nose, or a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't have any of those symptoms.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, you mentioned you felt feverish. Do you feel hot now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not right now, but I did have, last night just, was just very chilly and Uh, I had to just wrap myself up in a couple blankets.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Did you have any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I, I didn't have any night sweats.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and have you had any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, so how about any dizziness or lightheadedness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any wheeze?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No wheezing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, and have you noticed any swelling to any of your extremities? Like your ankles?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no. Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any belly pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No belly pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any urinary problems like pain or, or frequency going to the bathroom?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And any diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and have you noticed any rashes or, or changes to your skin?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not at all.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and I don't know, you've had muscle aches, have you had any joint pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, no musc, sorry no joint pain. It's mainly just like in, I would say in around my upper back like my upper arms and kind of like my thighs and glutes areas

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how has your energy been these last couple of days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yesterday I felt a bit drained. I just kind of like stayed in bed the whole day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you tried any medications for the, for the headache or any of your symptoms so far?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I, I took a Tylenol. I actually took a couple Tylenols, uh, when the headache and pain started. It did help a bit for a couple hours, but it just kind of came back.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And in the past, have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, Just uh, like I had type 2 diabetes, that's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you using medications for your diabetes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've been on Metformin.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you used insulin before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, I've never had to use insulin. It's pretty stable, like my family doctors even considering taking me off the metformin.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, no, that's great. And that reminds me, actually, how has your weight been over the last several months? Have you had any weight changes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not really, like I, I, I think over the last two years I've just been very focused on my fitness, so I feel like I've probably lost around 30 pounds over the last year. Last one to two, yeah, year, but like I, I've been exercising a lot like uhm, gym every day, it's, it's been, it's been a journey.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: no that's great though, good for you. I encourage you to keep that up for sure. OK, and so do you take any other medications, other, over the counter or prescribed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, just a multi vitamins.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and do you have any allergies to medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: All right. So have you had any hospitalizations or surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and uh, anybody in the family have any like lung conditions, heart conditions or diseases that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, my, my son actually just recently was diagnosed with asthma. But I think that he gets that from his mom's side.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, you don't have any asthma or problems breathing like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and right now, so you mentioned your son and wife, is that who you're living with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's just us three.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh, any exposures to, to anybody who's been sick, either at home or at work or, or any other activities?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, unfortunately I do have to, uh, I'm one of the unlucky ones that still has to go into work. And yeah, it's it's hard to say like at work, there are times when we, like at lunch we eat like without a mask. I don't know if, I didn't notice anyone having any symptoms, but like, I don't know if someone, you know, who knows where anyone has been.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so nobody that you're aware of who's been sick though?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And everybody at home has been OK?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, at home everyone's good. I kind of just distance myself into like one room.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Mhm.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just in case anything goes wrong.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you traveled anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, we've been, we've been at home this whole time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've never smoked.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so do you, do you smoke marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright and you use any other recreational drugs like cocaine, opioids, heroin? And how, have you used anything like that in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. Never.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm, and do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, well just occasionally, like I would say maybe, maybe some wine, once, uh, like once every couple days. Maybe a beer on the weekend, but that's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. So I think that was all I wanted to ask on history today. Was there anything else that, that you wanted to add before we go on to the exam and?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I, I, I don't know if I should get a test done, like for covid. Uhm yeah, that's all, just wondering if I, if I can do that here?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so that is something that that is on the differential for what could be causing your symptoms, especially with uhm, starting at having a cough and the nonspecific viral type symptoms with the cough, headache, muscle aches, so certainly could be caused by covid, but there are other reasons for, that could explain these symptoms, such as other types of viral illnesses, and so we will do a PCR swab today, as well as do, well, check your vitals to see if you have a fever now and we'll also maybe send an influenza swab as well, and and do some blood work. But in the meantime, since we're running the covid swab, it will be important to self isolate for the next 14 days and we will let you know what the test results show. But despite, even if they are negative, it will be important to still stay self isolating for the next 14 days.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, I'll do that. That sounds good.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
